summary: This teensy little plugin adds a diary belonging to everyone's least favorite Redguard, Braith.
descriptionHtml:
My characters, like many others, have never had a good encounter with Braith. Ashlyn has brought up her fists and Lizzy came within milliseconds of casting Tharn's Prison on the little brat. I mean, who doesn't wish they had a chance to teach her a lesson?

Well... I recently overheard Braith's feeble attempts to engage her parents in dialogue inside their home and this had an effect on me. In my 2400+ hours of Skyrim I have never heard this dialogue before, and it left a bit of a burn in my heart. See, I work with children IRL, and when dealing with a child who has serious anger issues, bullies other children and shows disrespect to elders, I always find out what it is, deep down in their little hearts what is causing such feelings. And the solution is NOT to make them killable or transform them into a spider. Usually a child can write their feelings to get them out of their system. In some cases, I allow them access to a punching bag. Since Braith has no punching bag, I've added a diary where she has written a couple of pages about her feelings.

Now, I'm not the best writer, and certainly not a respectable modder, so take it easy on me, lol If anything this is just something I wanted to share and hopefully it will spark some empathy for Braith.

Requirements: Skyrim

Install: Move plugin to Data folder, activate in your favorite modding utility or Skyrim's launcher

Uninstall: This plugin should be safe to deactivate and uninstall at any time as long as you are outside of Amren's house

Compatibility: Since all this mod does is add an end table container and Braith's diary, it [u]shoudn't[/u] conflict with anything other than another mod that alters the interior of Amren's house.
author: Kanori24
